text: Many years ago a man named Ulysses lived in Greece (who, though quite wise, was very cunning), married to Penelope, a beautiful and uniquely gifted woman whose only defect was her excessive love of weaving, a custom through which she could spend long seasons alone. Legend has it that on every occasion when Ulysses with his cunning observed that despite his prohibitions she once again set out to start one of his endless fabrics, she could be seen at night sneaking up on her boots and a good boat, until without telling anything she was going to travel the world and look for herself. In this way she managed to keep him away while flirting with her suitors, making them believe that she weaves while Ulysses was traveling and not that Ulysses was traveling while she weaves, as Homer may have imagined, who, as is known, sometimes slept and didn't realize anything. FIN
title: La tela de Penélope o quién engaña a quién
author: Augusto Monterroso
